intro: Racosperma axillare, commonly known as the axillary racosperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub with small, compound leaves and produces yellow or white flowers. Its fruits are pod-like structures that contain several seeds. Racosperma axillare is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
